solution_line_template: At {local_call_cost_per_minute} cents a minute, calling his father cost Freddy {local_call_cost_per_minute}* {local_call_duration} = <<{local_call_cost_per_minute}*{local_call_duration}={cost_local_call_cents}>>{cost_local_call_cents} cents.

At {international_call_cost_per_minute} cents a minute, calling his brother cost Freddy {international_call_cost_per_minute} * {international_call_duration} = <<{international_call_cost_per_minute}*{international_call_duration}={cost_international_call_cents}>>{cost_international_call_cents} cents.

Adding the cost of calling his father and brother, we find that Freddy paid a total of {cost_local_call_cents} + {cost_international_call_cents} = <<{cost_local_call_cents}+{cost_international_call_cents}={total_cost_cents}>>{total_cost_cents} cents.
Since each dollar has {cents_per_dollar} cents, Freddy paid {total_cost_cents} / {cents_per_dollar} = <<{total_cost_cents}/{cents_per_dollar}={total_cost_dollars}>>{total_cost_dollars} dollars
